t: Isaiah 32
A Reign of Righteousness
Behold,*pn a king will reign in righteousness, And*ld princes will rule with justice.
A*ld man will be as a hiding place from the wind, And*ld a cover from the tempest, As*ld rivers of water in a dry place, As*ld the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.
The*ld eyes of those who see will not be dim, And*ld the ears of those who hear will listen.
Also*ld the heart of the rash will understand knowledge, And*ld the tongue of the stammerers will be ready to speak plainly.
The*ln foolish person will no longer be called generous, Nor*ld the miser said to*i be*i bountiful;

For*ld the foolish person will speak foolishness, And*ld his heart will work iniquity: To*ld practice ungodliness, To*ld utter error against the Lord,*s To*ld keep the hungry unsatisfied, And*ld he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
Also*ld the schemes of the schemer are*i evil; He*ld devises wicked plans To*ld destroy the poor with lying words, Even*ld when the needy speaks justice.
But*ld a generous man devises generous things, And*ld by generosity he shall stand.
Consequences of Complacency
Rise*pn up, you women who are at ease, Hear*ld my voice; You*ld complacent daughters, Give*ld ear to my speech.
In*ld a year and some*i days You*ld will be troubled, you complacent women; For*ld the vintage will fail, The*ld gathering will not come.
Tremble,*ld you women*i who are at ease; Be*ld troubled, you complacent ones; Strip*ld yourselves, make yourselves bare, And*ld gird sackcloth*i on your*i waists.
People*ln shall mourn upon their breasts For*ld the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
On*ld the land of my people will come up thorns and*i briers, Yes,*ld on all the happy homes in*i the joyous city;
Because*ld the palaces will be forsaken, The*ld bustling city will be deserted. The*ld forts and towers will become lairs forever, A*ld joy of wild donkeys, a pasture of flocks—
Until*ld the Spirit is poured upon us from on high, And*ld the wilderness becomes a fruitful field, And*ld the fruitful field is counted as a forest.
The Peace of God’s Reign
Then*pn justice will dwell in the wilderness, And*ld righteousness remain in the fruitful field.
The*ld work of righteousness will be peace, And*ld the effect of righteousness, quietness and assurance forever.
My*ld people will dwell in a peaceful habitation, In*ld secure dwellings, and in quiet resting places,
Though*ld hail comes down on the forest, And*ld the city is brought low in humiliation.
Blessed*ln are*i you who sow beside all waters, Who*ld send out freely the feet of the ox and the donkey.
